page.title: 06SWINFORD PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The Vicar of Swinford, Rev.John Lindsay made an application to the Board of Charity Commissioners for England and Wales in{1870}for a Church school which was founded in{1875}for 70-80 pupils from surrounding villages In{1979}an extension was completed. The school comprises three classrooms, a hall with kitchen, an office, staffroom, library and cloakrooms. Children attend{Swinford School}for primary education. In{1985}there is a Headteacher assisted by two teachers and various part time staff including a secretary, caretaker, dinner ladies and numerous voluntary helpers. There are now 52 pupils divided into infant, lower junior and upper junior classes. There is a Board of Governors who assist in the running of the school. Secondary school pupils travel by bus to schools in Lutterworth.
